static void lfs_log_ensure_dir(void) {
    struct stat st;
    if (stat("/tmp/logs", &st) != 0) {
        /* attempt to create directory if it doesn't exist; ignore errors */
        (void)mkdir("/tmp/logs", 0755);
    }
}
static void lfs_log_printf(const char *fmt, ...) {
    lfs_log_ensure_dir();
    FILE *f = fopen("/tmp/logs/274.txt", "a");
    if (!f) {
        return;
    }
    va_list ap;
    va_start(ap, fmt);
    vfprintf(f, fmt, ap);
    va_end(ap);
    fputs("\n", f);
    fclose(f);
}

Here are the constraints for the test code:
- The test code MUST be compilable and executable.
- The test code MUST include line breaks.

<instruction>
Please fix the code so that it compiles successfully.
</instruction>
explanation: The build error was caused by an unterminated comment and an incomplete function body for lfs_dir_tell. I closed the comment, added the missing probe/exit logging, unlocked the previously acquired lock with LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg), and returned the result. These changes preserve the original logic and ensure the function is properly terminated so the file compiles.
